      73             : /**
      74             :  * Some functionality that has historically lived on nsPresContext does not
      75             :  * actually need to be per-document. This singleton class serves as a host
      76             :  * for that functionality. We delegate to it from nsPresContext where

     108             : 
     109             :   /**
     110             :    * Fetch the user's font preferences for the given aLanguage's
     111             :    * langugage group.
     112             :    *
     113             :    * The original code here is pretty old, and includes an optimization
     114             :    * whereby language-specific prefs are read per-document, and the
     115             :    * results are stored in a linked list, which is assumed to be very short
     116             :    * since most documents only ever use one language.
     117             :    *
     118             :    * Storing this per-session rather than per-document would almost certainly
     119             :    * be fine. But just to be on the safe side, we leave the old mechanism as-is,
     120             :    * with an additional per-session cache that new callers can use if they don't
     121             :    * have a PresContext.
     122             :    */
     123             :   const LangGroupFontPrefs* GetFontPrefsForLangHelper(nsIAtom* aLanguage,
     124             :                                                       const LangGroupFontPrefs* aPrefs) const;
     125             :   /**
     126             :    * Get the default font for the given language and generic font ID.
     127             :    * aLanguage may not be nullptr.
     128             :    *
     129             :    * This object is read-only, you must copy the font to modify it.
     130             :    *
     131             :    * When aFontID is kPresContext_DefaultVariableFontID or
     132             :    * kPresContext_DefaultFixedFontID (which equals
     133             :    * kGenericFont_moz_fixed, which is used for the -moz-fixed generic),
     134             :    * the nsFont returned has its name as a CSS generic family (serif or
     135             :    * sans-serif for the former, monospace for the latter), and its size
     136             :    * as the default font size for variable or fixed fonts for the
     137             :    * language group.
     138             :    *
     139             :    * For aFontID corresponding to a CSS Generic, the nsFont returned has
     140             :    * its name set to that generic font's name, and its size set to
     141             :    * the user's preference for font size for that generic and the
     142             :    * given language.
     143             :    */
